results.title: Five revolutionary painters: Brueghel
results.brief_description: This film is about the 16th century Flemish painter Peter Brueghel. A cultivated townsman, Brueghel rejected the manner and style of his contemporaries and painted landscapes and scenes of country life so truthfully that his pictures reflect every aspect of the day-to-day life of that time. Among Brueghel’s work we see “Hunter in the Snow”, “Road to Calvary”, “Taxing at Bethlehem”, “Blind Leading the Blind” and “Wedding Feast”. Narrated by Sir Kenneth Clark.

results.title: The Five ports
results.creator_credit: Patrick N Wood and Paul Barralet Productions
results.brief_description: A description of the Cinque Ports - Dover, Sandwich, Hastings, Romney and Hythe. Something of their history is also included, and views of the surrounding countryside.

results.title: Five one five five
results.brief_description: A number of “jumbo” wool bales has been experimentally packed and shipped from Australia as part of an effort to increase efficiency in the wool industry. Each bale weighs 450 kgs in contrast to the standard 150 kgs bale. The weight and shape of the new bale fully utilizes economies of mass handling equipment and procedure.

results.title: The Five Chinese brothers
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Once upon a time there were five identical Chinese brothers. The first brother could swallow the sea, the second had an iron neck. The third brother could stretch his legs, the fourth could not be burned and the fifth Chinese brother could hold his breath indefinitely. This amusing riddle tells how the five brothers outwit the townspeople and save themselves from a tragic end.

results.title: Five Aboriginal dances from Cape York
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The legends and stories of Australia’s First Nations peoples have been kept alive in song and dance. This film shows dancing at the Aurunum Mission Station in the north of Queensland. The dances are: “ATHA AND PANTJ” - three men die and change into the crow, dove and gecko lizard; “MUIPAKA” - the penalty for adultery is death; “NINGKUSHUN AND ORPUL” - Orpul the fairy girl created the freshwater shark; “PIKUWA AND KENA” - the freshwater and saltwater crocodile fight; “PIPAPEPE” - the courting and mating of the curlews.

results.title: Fitzroy: coming up for air
results.creator_credit: Peter Dodds and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: An overview of aspects of life in Fitzroy, an inner-city suburb of Melbourne, where there are a large number of Housing Commission high-rise blocks of flats. Residents and people working in the community discuss the quality of life in Fitzroy.

results.title: Fitzroy
results.brief_description: Shows the great difficulties and final success of climbing the South East buttress of Mount Fitzroy in South America in 1968. The early part of the film discusses Captain Robert Fitzroy, who explored the coast of Argentina, and his naturalist Charles Darwin who did extensive work in Patagonia.

results.title: Fitting the job to the worker: an introduction to ergonomics
results.creator_credit: David Cons, Frank A. Hoare, British Productivity Council and Merton Park
results.brief_description: An introduction to industrial ergonomics, a subject covering the study of all factors affecting the physical and psychological relationship between man and his artificial environment, including such factors as lighting, display, heat and sound, and age.

results.title: Fit to fight
results.creator_credit: Gordon Stewart, Ronald H. Riley, Army Kinema Corporation and R.H.R. Productions
results.brief_description: The physical training of the British Army, showing how it is carefully planned to help every recruit to reach his own individual peak of fitness. Explains the necessity for this high standard of physical well-being by showing how the training relates to different activities in the field.
